フォームをダウンロード 個人情報保護誓約書 (Kojin Joho Hogo)

The Kojin Joho Hogo Seiyakusho is a specialized pledge focusing on the Protection of Personal Information (PPI). With the tightening of Japan's Act on the Protection of Personal Information (APPI), companies are under strict pressure to ensure their employees do not mishandle data regarding customers, partners, or fellow employees.

Why this is Distinct
While general confidentiality agreements cover trade secrets (like recipes or code), this pledge specifically targets personal data (names, addresses, phone numbers, credit card info). This is particularly mandatory for roles in HR, sales, and medical fields where sensitive individual data is processed daily.

Employee Obligations
The signer promises to access personal data only for legitimate business purposes (no "snooping" on celebrities or acquaintances). It also mandates immediate reporting of any data breach incidents, such as losing a USB drive or sending an email to the wrong recipient, which is a common cause of corporate scandal in Japan.
